task_summary: Detect and approach the Coca-Cola can, compute a side pinch grasp, grasp it, lift slightly, verify the object is held, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene shows multiple small objects (cans, bottles, a cup) arranged in a row. The robot arm must pick the Coca-Cola can (red cylinder). The behavior first ensures the gripper is open, detects and centers on the target, then computes a side grasp suitable for a parallel two-finger gripper. After executing the grasp, it closes with moderate force, lifts the can a short distance to confirm clearance, checks that the object is indeed in the gripper, and retreats to a safe height/offset to end in a stable state.
preconditions: Robot reachable workspace includes the Coca-Cola can.
Camera view contains the can with sufficient contrast.
Gripper operational and free of obstructions.
stepwise_plan: Move above target, approach and align with low tolerance.
Compute grasp pose (side strategy) and execute the grasp.
Close gripper, raise held object slightly.
Verify object in gripper and retreat.
success_criteria: Coca-Cola can is firmly in the gripper.
Can is lifted from the table without collision.
Robot retreats to a safe pose with can held.
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, retry detection up to three times.
If alignment or grasp fails, re-detect and re-attempt.
If object slips after lift, reopen, re-plan grasp, and try again.
task_long_description.termination: Tree succeeds when 'ObjectInGripper' is true after lifting and the retreat completes.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Open gripper to a safe width for approach.
Perception step to localize the Coca-Cola can.
Move to a pre-grasp height above the target.
Center TCP with tight tolerance before grasp.
Plan a side pinch grasp pose.
Lift object to clear the surface.
Back off to a safe pose.

recovery_strategy: Re-align and re-grasp with new pose
assumptions: The red cylinder in the center row corresponds to a Coca-Cola can; frames show approach→grasp→lift motion consistent with a pick task.

expected_success_criteria: Can is raised at least 0.1 m and remains held after retreat.
